As he typically does at the end of every season, on Monday Thunder GM Sam Presti spoke at length with reporters as he shared his view of the Thunder in 2021-22, the upcoming offseason and the teamâ€™s connection to OKC

Full Story ğŸ“ â¤µï¸

âWe're trying to create a future. We're going to enjoy and embrace and love whatever happens here because it's going to be ours and the people who are walking with us. It's going to be individually ours, Oklahoma'sâ

- Exec. VP and GM, Sam Presti

âWe have confidence that we are going to be successful. But the only way is if we show humility in the face of what we are trying to accomplish, keep our head down and focus not on what we need to do, but how we need to do it.â

- Exec. VP and GM, Sam Presti

âPeople in Oklahoma don't expect to be handed things. They expect to work for that they get, they expect to do it together, unified.â

- Exec. VP and GM, Sam Presti

âCOVID disrupted more than anything for us community engagement. We havenâ€™t been able to be out in the way that we know how to and want to.â

- Exec. VP and GM, Sam Presti

âTrying to fix things quickly takes a very long time. You canâ€™t have one eye on the clock and one eye on the destination. We need to have two eyes on the path.â

- Exec. VP and GM, Sam Presti

âWeâ€™re closer to being the team we want to be this season than we were last season, but weâ€™re still really far away from ultimately getting to the level we want to be at.â

- Exec. VP and GM, Sam Presti

âWe are heading into our second draft as we continue to reposition the team. It allows us to build some continuity. That continuity is really important to us.â

- Exec. VP and GM, Sam Presti

âOklahoma State Motto. Labor Omnia Vincit. Hard work conquers all. That's the mentality of the team. We have a lot of hard work in front of us. We have to grind in and do it. That's what the state is about.â

- Exec. VP and GM, Sam Presti

âOur team has to be more physical next season. You canâ€™t play meaningful games or games of consequence if youâ€™re not playing physical and competing.â

- Exec. VP and GM, Sam Presti

âIt boiled down to competitiveness. Itâ€™s not about wins and losses, itâ€™s about teeing it up and understanding what it is we are trying to accomplish as a group and competing.â

- Exec. VP and GM, Sam Presti

âI feel just about every single guy improved, but the important thing was the development of the team itself. Halfway through the year, we started playing more efficiently. We started finding a style of play that enhanced the guys that we had.â
